title: Ticket #1149: Change bare system() calls to runcmd() in .run files in test suite
description:
runcmd in CondorUtils.pm is, for testing purposes. largely superior to system, `backticks`, and other ways of calling out to another program. It returns standard output and error, can automatically fail the test if the command fails, and more. See more documentation in CondorUtils.pm or at RunCmd.

  1. Document that new tests should use runcmd
  2. Convert a few tests to use runcmd as a proof of concept.
  3. Convert the rest of the tests as time permits. Possible STUDENTTASK.
  4. Commit each changed test as a unique commit (so it, and only it, can be reverted in case of problem)!

Here are a collection of tests which use system(). Change only the bare system() call (whose return value is not inspected), with runcmd. Run the test before and after to ensure nothing broke.

Milestone

  • 06/02/2010 - Do next batch of bare system comversions.

  • 04/16/2010 - Commit code. [DONE]
    • mccardel is busy on non-condor projects until the 14th.

  • 04/07/2010 - Code review current work. [DONE]

  • 04/02/2010 - Get rid of bare system() calls in as many calls as possible [DONE]:

  • Future - Get rid of system() calls where the return value is checked:

  • Future - Get rid of backtick invocations and replace with runcmd():

remarks:
2010-Jun-30 11:38:10 by psilord:
As of this comment, all bare system() and verbose_system() calls have been changed to runcmd(). At this point, all returns values are checked for system(), runcmd() (does a self check), and the remaining verbose_system() calls.

2010-Jun-30 11:44:16 by psilord:
We decided that since all return values are checked, that it wouldn't be a good use of time to change checked system() calls to runcmd(). If for some reason we decide that's needed it'll probably be a different ticket.
